genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.control_submission_output(submission_file_path, out_folder_fp, verbose)[source]

Checks to see if a submission file code is not more than 25000 character, if it is returns an error :param verbose: printing more information to the screen :param out_folder_fp: a filepath of where the output will be :param submission_file_path: a filepath where a JSON file is

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.define_parser()[source]

Defines accepted CLI syntax and the actions to take for command and args.

Returns:

argparse parser

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.determine_testing_result(pytest_output)[source]

Automate reading the pytest output to determine if the tests passed, the tests failed, or if there was a runtime error. :param pytest_output: The output of pytest as a string.

Returns:

-1 if the test code has a runtime error, 0 if the tests ran but failed on the code or if it’s a type of error listed below for a specific function. and 1 if the tests ran and passed on the code there are some expectations!

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.execute_pytest_without_printing(test_dir)[source]

Runs pytest on all files in the specified test directory and stores the output of pytest. The output is not printed to the screen and is returned. :param test_dir: the path to the test directory :type test_dir: str

Returns: the output from running pytest as a string.

Checks to see if a submission file path or problem filepath is a valid JSON, if yes returns true if not returns false :param verbose: printing more information to the screen :param out_folder_fp: a filepath of where the output is :param json_filepath: a filepath where a JSON file is

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.is_json_correct(filepath)[source]

Checks to see if a filepath is a valid JSON, if yes returns true if not returns false :param filepath: a filepath

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.is_prompt_correct(submission_file_path, problem_file_path, out_folder_fp, verbose)[source]

Checks to see if a submission file has a valid prompt number. For prompt number 1, it is a fixed prompt. If fixed prompt, checks to see if the prompt is the same fixed prompt we have given, if this is true will return true. If prompt number is 1 - 9, it is a custom prompt, need to make sure each submission has at least one custom prompt per problem. If all this matches returns true. If prompt number or prompt for fixed prompt is something else, returns false. :param verbose: printing more information to the screen :param out_folder_fp: a filepath where the messages from this function will be stored. :param submission_file_path: a filepath where a submission JSON file is :param problem_file_path: a filepath where a problem JSON file is

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.is_prompt_num_str(submission_file_path, out_folder_fp, verbose)[source]

Checks to see if a submission file does not have any empty fields - if yes will return false :param verbose: printing more information to the screen :param out_folder_fp: a filepath of where the output will be :param submission_file_path: a filepath where a JSON file is

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.is_submission_field_empty(submission_file_path, out_folder_fp, verbose)[source]

Checks to see if a submission file does not have any empty fields - if yes will return false :param verbose: printing more information to the screen :param out_folder_fp: a filepath where the output will be :param submission_file_path: a filepath where a JSON file is

Returns: boolean - True or False

genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.main()[source]
genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.run_pytest_on_code(curr_test_dir, verbose)[source]
genai_code_test.evaluation_environment.validate_submission.validate_code_submission(str_current_datetime, prob_json_filepath, submission_json_filepath, temp_test_dir, output_dir, system_name, verbose)[source]

Validates the submitted json file of generated tests relative to the problem json file. Prints out errors with “ERROR: …” and warnings with “WARNINGS: …” Warnings can be ignored but often indicate a problem with the submission. However, a submission must be free of all errors to pass validation.

Parameters:

  • str_current_datetime (datetime) – The date and time provided. If this is “” (default), then automatically

  • previous (create the current date and time. This parameter is enabled so that if someone wishes to overwrite)

  • folder (output in a)

  • default (that previous date can be specified. By)

  • "". (leave)

  • prob_json_filepath (str) – The path to the problem json file.

  • submission_json_filepath (str) – The path to the submission json file

  • temp_test_dir (str) – The path to the temporary directory where test files can be created and deleted

  • output_dir – The directory to write the output to

  • system_name – The name of the system. Defaults to “”, which means that the system name will be extracted from the submission json.

  • verbose (bool) – True if verbose output is enabled. False otherwise.

Returns: The validator outputs as a bool. If the validation is successful, it will return True if not it will return False.
